Landscape with Figures: by Ernest Hemingway
有人影的远景: 作者：欧内斯特·海明威

Landscape with Figures: It was very strange in that house.
有人影的远景: 那栋房子里的情况奇怪极了。

Landscape with Figures: The elevator, of course, no longer ran.
有人影的远景: 电梯自然早已停开。

Landscape with Figures: The steel column it slid up and down on was bent and there were several marble stairs in the six flights which were broken so that you had to walk carefully on the edges as you climbed so that you would not fall through.
有人影的远景: 它顺着上下滑动的那根钢柱也已经弯曲了。六层的大理石楼梯，有好几级都破裂了，所以爬楼梯时，你必须小心地踩在边上，免得掉下去。

Landscape with Figures: There were doors which opened onto rooms where there were no longer any rooms and you could swing a perfectly sound-looking door open and step across the door sill into space: that floor and the next three floors below having been blasted out of the front of the apartment house by direct hits by high explosive shells.
有人影的远景: 有些通向房间的门后面其实早已没有了房间。要是你扭开一扇看上去完好无损的门，一脚跨过门槛，便很可能踩空：这座公寓楼曾被高爆炮弹直接击中，四楼和底下三层的正面都被炸掉了。

Landscape with Figures: Yet the two top floors had four rooms on the front of the house which were intact and there was still running water in the back rooms on all of the floors.
有人影的远景: 但是最高两层的正面倒有四个房间还完好无损，所有楼层背面的房间也都还有自来水。

Landscape with Figures: We called this house the Old Homestead.
有人影的远景: 我们叫这栋房子“老宅子”。

Landscape with Figures: The front line had, at the vey worst moment, been directly below this apartment house along the upper edge of the little plateau that the boulevard circled and the trench and the weather-rotted sandbags were still there.
有人影的远景: 在战争最严峻的时候，前线就在这栋公寓的正下方，位于林阴大道环绕的小高地顶上的边沿。战壕和被淋坏晒烂的沙袋至今仍在原处。

Landscape with Figures: They were so close you could throw a broken tile or a piece of mortar from the smashed apartment house down into them as you stood on one of the balconies.
有人影的远景: 它们是那么近，以至于站在这座残破公寓的一个阳台上，你就可以扔块破瓦或者灰泥片过去。

Landscape with Figures: But now the line had been pushed down from the lip of the plateau, across the river and up into the pine-studded slope of the hill that rose behind the old royal hunting lodge that was called the Caso del Campo.
有人影的远景: 但现在前线已经从高地边沿推进到了河对岸松树散布的山坡上，那座小山就耸立在一个叫“村舍”的旧日皇家猎舍后面。

Landscape with Figures: It was there that the fighting was going on, now, and we used the Old Homestead both as an observation post and as an advantage point to film from.
有人影的远景: 现在战斗就是在那里进行着，我们把“老宅子”当作观察哨和拍摄新闻片的有利地点。

Landscape with Figures: In those days it was very dangerous and always cold and we were always hungry and we joked a great deal.
有人影的远景: 那时形势非常危险，天总是那么冷，我们又总是饿肚子，但常常开玩笑。

Landscape with Figures: Each time a shell bursts in a building it makes a great cloud of brick and plaster dust and when this settles it coats the surface of a mirror so that it is as powdered as the windows which have been calcimined over in a new building.
有人影的远景: 每次炮弹击中建筑物，砖块和石膏都被炸成粉末，像一大团云；等它们落下来，镜面上全是灰，就像新房子的窗上涂了白粉一样。

Landscape with Figures: There was a tall unbroken mirror in one of the rooms of that house giving off the stairs as you climbed and on its dusty surface I printed, with my finger, in large letters DEATH TO JOHNNY and we then sent Johnny, the camera-man, into that room on some pretext.
有人影的远景: 顺着这栋房子的楼梯往上爬，你会发现楼梯旁延伸出的一个房间里居然有面长镜没有破损。我用手指在布满灰尘的镜面上划下了大大的“约翰尼必死”的字样，然后我们找了个托词让摄影师约翰尼到那个房间去。

Landscape with Figures: When he opened the door, during a shelling, and saw that ghostly announcement staring at him from the glass he went into a white, deadly, Dutch rage and it was quite a time before we were friends again.
有人影的远景: 当时正是炮击关头，他打开门看见那可怕的宣告直勾勾地从镜子里盯着他，顿时就面色煞白、勃然大怒，为此过了好久我们才重归于好。

Landscape with Figures: Then the next day when we were loading the equipment into a car in front of the hotel I got into the car and cranked up the glass of the side window as it was bitterly cold.
有人影的远景: 第二天，我们在旅馆前面往一辆车里装器材。天气非常寒冷，于是我上车后就把一边的窗玻璃摇了上去。

Landscape with Figures: As the glass rose I saw, printed on it with large red letters in what must have been a borrowed lipstick, ED IS A LICE.
有人影的远景: 车窗摇起后，我看见上面印着几个红色的大字：“埃德是个虱子”，想必是用借来的口红写上去的。

Landscape with Figures: We used the car for several days with that mysterious, to the Spaniards, slogan.
有人影的远景: 一连几天我们都在用这辆写着标语的车，这标语在西班牙人看来很神秘。

Landscape with Figures: They must have taken it for the initials or slogan of some Holland-American revolutionary organization perhaps resembling the F.A.I. or the C.N.T.
有人影的远景: 他们一定把这几个字当成了某个荷兰或美国的革命组织（也许类似F.A.I.或者C.N.T.这样的组织）的名称缩写或标语。

Landscape with Figures: Then there was the day when the great British authority on let us forget just what came to town.
有人影的远景: 后来有一天，有位英国官员却使我们忘记了之前的那点儿不快。

Landscape with Figures: He had a huge, German-type steel helmet which he wore on all expeditions in the direction of the front.
有人影的远景: 他有顶巨大的德国式钢盔，每次出行，只要是往前线方向去，他都会戴着它。

Landscape with Figures: This was an item of clothing which none of the rest of us affected.
有人影的远景: 对这种装束我们都没什么好感。

Landscape with Figures: It was the general theory that since there were not many steel helmets these should be reserved for the shock troops and his wearing of this helmet formed in us an instant prejudice against the Great Authority.
有人影的远景: 按常理，既然这种钢盔并不多，就应该留给突击部队。因此这位大员戴着这顶钢盔让我们立即对他产生了反感。

Landscape with Figures: We had met in the room of an American woman journalist who had a splendid electric heater.
有人影的远景: 我们是在一位美国女记者的住所里碰上的，那位女记者有只上好的电炉。

Landscape with Figures: The Authority took an instant fancy to this very pleasant room and named it the Club.
有人影的远景: 官员很快就喜欢上了那个舒适的房间，还叫它“俱乐部”。

Landscape with Figures: His proposal was that everyone should bring their own liquor there and be able to enjoy it in the warmth and pleasant atmosphere.
有人影的远景: 他建议大家都自带酒水，好在这温暖、愉悦的气氛中享用。

Landscape with Figures: As the American girl was exceedingly hard-working and had been trying, perhaps not too successfully, to keep her room from becoming in any sense the Club, this definite baptism and classification came as rather a blow to her.
有人影的远景: 可那美国女记者工作极其勤奋，一直努力不让自己的住所染上“俱乐部”的色彩（虽然也许不是太成功）。因此这样明确的命名和归类对她来说是个不小的打击。

Landscape with Figures: We were working there in the Old Homestead the next day, shielding the camera lens as carefully as possible against the glare of the afternoon sun with a screen of broken matting, when the Authority arrived accompanied by the American girl.
有人影的远景: 第二天，我们正在“老宅子”里工作，用一条破席子当屏风，尽可能小心地让摄像机镜头避开下午耀眼的阳光，这时候那位官员由美国女记者陪着来了。

Landscape with Figures: He had heard us discussing the location at the Club and had come to pay a visit.
有人影的远景: 他在“俱乐部”里听我们谈到过这个场所，就特意过来看看。

Landscape with Figures: I was using a pair of field glasses, eight power, small Zeisses that you could cover with your two hands so that they gave no reflection, and was observing from the shadow in the angle of the broken balcony.
有人影的远景: 当时我正在破阳台一角的阴影里用一副双筒望远镜观察。那是小型的八倍蔡司镜，用双手一盖，它就不会反光了。

Landscape with Figures: The attack was about to start and we were waiting for the planes to come over and commence the bombardment which substituted for adequate artillery preparation due to the Government’s then shortage of heavy artillery.
有人影的远景: 这时进攻快要开始了，我们等待着飞机过来开始轰炸，以此来代替当时由于政府缺乏重炮而没作好的炮击准备。

Landscape with Figures: We had worked in the house, concealing ourselves as carefully as rats do because the success of our work and the possibility of continued observation depended altogether on not drawing any fire on the seemingly deserted building.
有人影的远景: 我们一向在那房子里工作，把自己像耗子一样小心地藏起来。因为要想工作成功，有继续观测的可能，就绝不能给这栋看似被遗弃的公寓招来任何炮火。

Landscape with Figures: Now into the room came the Great Authority, and drawing up one of the empty chairs, seated himself in the exact center of the open balcony, steel helmet, over-sized binoculars and all.
有人影的远景: 此时，官员走进房间，拉了一把空椅子，坐在一览无余的开敞式阳台的正中心，钢盔、大号望远镜等等一应俱全。

Landscape with Figures: The camera was at an angle on one side of the balcony window as carefully camouflaged as a machine gun.
有人影的远景: 摄影机斜设在阳台窗户的一侧，像机关枪一样被精心伪装。

Landscape with Figures: I was in the angle of shadow on the other, invisible to anyone on the hillside, and always careful never to move across the sunny open space.
有人影的远景: 我则是在另一侧布满阴影的角落里（山坡上的任何人都看不见我），而且一直注意从不穿过阳光照射的开阔处。

Landscape with Figures: The Authority was seated in plain sight in the middle of the sunny patch looking, in his steel hat, like the head of all the general staffs in the world, his glasses blinking in the sun like a helio.
有人影的远景: 而这官员却堂而皇之坐在向阳地中间，头戴钢盔，像全球参谋部的总指挥似的。他的望远镜在阳光下闪闪发光，像一架日光反射信号器。

Landscape with Figures: “Look,” I said to him.
有人影的远景: “你看，”我对他说，

Landscape with Figures: “We have to work here.
有人影的远景: “我们得在这儿工作。

Landscape with Figures: From where you’re sitting your glasses make a blink that everybody on that hill can see.”
有人影的远景: 你坐在这儿，望远镜反射的光能叫山上所有的人都看见。”

Landscape with Figures: “Ay dount think theys aneh dainjah een a house,” the Authority said with calm and condescending dignity.
有人影的远景: “我觉得在房子里没有任何危险。”官员用高高在上的口气平静地说。

Landscape with Figures: “If you ever hunted mountain sheep,” I said, “you know they can see you as far as you can see them.
有人影的远景: “你要是打过野山羊，”我说，“就应该知道：要是你看得到它们，它们也能看到你。

Landscape with Figures: Do you see how clearly you see the men with your glasses?
有人影的远景: 你没发现用你的望远镜看那些人有多清楚吗？

Landscape with Figures: They have glasses too.”
有人影的远景: 他们也有望远镜的。”

Landscape with Figures: “Ay dount think theys aneh dainjah een a house,” the Authority repeated.
有人影的远景: “我觉得在房子里没有任何危险，”官员重复道，

Landscape with Figures: “Wheah are the tanks?”
有人影的远景: “坦克在哪儿呢？”

Landscape with Figures: “There,” I said.
有人影的远景: “在那儿，”我说，

Landscape with Figures: “Under the trees.”
有人影的远景: “树底下。”

Landscape with Figures: The two cameramen were making grimaces and shaking their clenched fists over their heads in fury.
有人影的远景: 两个摄影师露出厌恶的表情，生气地在头顶上挥动攥紧的拳头。

Landscape with Figures: “I go to take the big camera into the back,” Johnny said.
有人影的远景: “我把大摄影机拿到后面去。”约翰尼说。

Landscape with Figures: “Keep well back, daughter,” I said to the American girl.
有人影的远景: “小妞儿，乖乖待在后面。”我冲那美国女记者说。

Landscape with Figures: Then, to the Authority, “They take you for somebody’s staff, you know.
有人影的远景: 然后我又告诉官员：“你知道吧，他们把你当谁的参谋了！

Landscape with Figures: They see that tin hat and those glasses and they think we’re running the battle.
有人影的远景: 他们看到你的钢盔和望远镜，还以为我们在指挥作战呢！

Landscape with Figures: You’re asking for it, you know.”
有人影的远景: 你这是在自找麻烦，知道吗？”

Landscape with Figures: He repeated his refrain.
有人影的远景: 他还是重复着那句老话。

Landscape with Figures: It was at that minute that the first one hit us.
有人影的远景: 就在那一刻，第一颗炮弹袭击了我们。

Landscape with Figures: It came with a noise like a bursted steam pipe combined with a ripping of canvas and with the burst and the roar and rattle of broken plaster and the dust smoke over us I had the girl out of the room and into the back of the apartment.
有人影的远景: 它发出一声巨响，那声音就像蒸汽管爆裂加上帆布撕裂。在爆炸的轰隆声和破碎的灰墙掉下时发出的嘎嘎声里，我推着那女记者跑出烟雾弥漫的房间，躲到公寓后面的房间里。

Landscape with Figures: As I dove through the door something with a steel hat on passed me going for the stairs.
有人影的远景: 正当我冲出房门，一个戴着钢盔的家伙从我身边一闪而过，向楼梯那边跑去。

Landscape with Figures: You may think a rabbit moves fast when it first jumps and starts zigzagging away, but the Authority moved through that smoke-filled hall, down those tricky stairs, out the door, and down the street faster than any rabbit.
有人影的远景: 你或许会觉得一只兔子一跃而起，左一蹦右一跳地跑掉时的速度已经够快了。可这位官员窜过烟雾弥漫的走廊，冲下那难走的楼梯，夺门而出，钻到街上的速度可要快过任何一只兔子。

Landscape with Figures: One of the cameramen said he had no speed on the lens of his Leica which would stop him in motion.
有人影的远景: 我们的一位摄影师说他的莱卡摄像机的镜头都来不及定格官员的动作。

Landscape with Figures: This of course is inaccurate but it gives the effect.
有人影的远景: 这固然有些过甚之辞，但也说得一针见血。

Landscape with Figures: Anyway they shelled the house fast for about a minute.
有人影的远景: 总之他们对这栋公寓快速轰炸了大约一分钟。

Landscape with Figures: They came on such a flat trajectory you hardly had time to hold a breath between the rush and the jolt and roar of the burst.
有人影的远景: 炮弹沿着直线轨迹飞射过来，陡然一震，轰地一响。在这期间你几乎没有时间来屏住呼吸。

Landscape with Figures: Then after the last one we waited a couple of minutes to see if it had stopped, had a drink of water from the tap in the kitchen sink, and found a new room to set up the camera.
有人影的远景: 最后一次轰炸过后，我们等了几分钟，看是真的结束了，于是我们就到厨房，拧开水池上的水龙头喝了点儿水，又重新找了个房间，架起摄影机。

Landscape with Figures: The attack was just starting.
有人影的远景: 进攻正好刚刚开始。

Landscape with Figures: The American girl was very bitter against the Authority.
有人影的远景: 美国女记者恨透了那个官员。

Landscape with Figures: “He brought me here,” she said.
有人影的远景: “是他带我来这儿的，”她说，

Landscape with Figures: “He said it was quite safe.
有人影的远景: “还说这里很安全。

Landscape with Figures: And he went away and did not even say good-bye.”
有人影的远景: 可他却跑掉了，连‘再见’也没说。”

Landscape with Figures: “He cahnt be a gentleman,” I said.
有人影的远景: “他可不是个绅士啊，”我说，

Landscape with Figures: “Look, daughter.
有人影的远景: “你瞧，小妞。

Landscape with Figures: Watch.
有人影的远景: 快看。

Landscape with Figures: Now.
有人影的远景: 就现在。

Landscape with Figures: There it goes.”
有人影的远景: 开始啦！”

Landscape with Figures: Below us some men stood up, half crouching, and ran forward toward a stone house in a patch of trees.
有人影的远景: 地面上有些士兵站起来，半弯着腰，朝一小片树林里的一座石头房子跑去。

Landscape with Figures: The house was disappearing in the sudden fountainings of dust clouds from the shells that were registering on it.
有人影的远景: 炮弹瞄准房子打去，那房子便逐渐消失在突然腾起的阵阵尘雾中了。

Landscape with Figures: The wind blew the dust clear after each shell so that the house kept showing plainly through the dust as a ship comes out of a fog and ahead of the men a tank lurched fast like a round-topped, gun-snouted beetle and went out of sight in the trees.
有人影的远景: 每次轰炸后，风把尘土吹尽，房子就像从雾里驶出的船一样清楚地显现出来。在士兵面前，有辆坦克颠簸着飞快前进，像只圆顶炮形鼻的甲虫，开进树林里就不见了。

Landscape with Figures: As you watched, the men who were running forward threw themselves flat.
有人影的远景: 正看着，那群跑步前进的士兵扑倒在地上。

Landscape with Figures: Then another tank went forward on the left and into the trees and you could see the flash of its firing and in the smoke that blew from the house one of the men who was on the ground stood up and ran wildly back toward the trench that they had left when they attacked.
有人影的远景: 接着另一辆坦克从左边冲上前去，进了树林，还可以看得到它开火的闪光。在石头房子冒出的烟雾中，扑在地上的一名士兵站了起来，发了疯似的跑回当初他们发动攻击时离开的战壕。

Landscape with Figures: Another got up and ran back, holding his rifle in one hand, his other hand on his head.
有人影的远景: 另一名士兵也起身往回跑，一手抓着步枪，一手抱着头。

Landscape with Figures: Then they were running back from all along the line.
有人影的远景: 后来，战线上的士兵全都往回跑。

Landscape with Figures: Some fell as they ran.
有人影的远景: 有些人跑着跑着就倒下了。

Landscape with Figures: Others lay on the ground without ever having got up.
有人影的远景: 有些躺在地上就再也起不来了。

Landscape with Figures: They were scattered all over the hillside.
有人影的远景: 他们散落在山坡各处。

Landscape with Figures: “What’s happened?” the girl asked.
有人影的远景: “怎么回事？”女记者问。

Landscape with Figures: “The attack has failed,” I said.
有人影的远景: “进攻失败了。”我说。

Landscape with Figures: “Why?”
有人影的远景: “为什么？”

Landscape with Figures: “It wasn’t pushed home.”
有人影的远景: “没有坚持到底。”

Landscape with Figures: “Why?
有人影的远景: “为什么？

Landscape with Figures: Wasn’t it just as dangerous for them to run back as to go forward?”
有人影的远景: 他们后退不是跟前进一样危险吗？”

Landscape with Figures: “Not quite.”
有人影的远景: “不一定。”

Landscape with Figures: The girl held the field glasses to her eyes.
有人影的远景: 女记者举起望远镜看，

Landscape with Figures: Then she put them down.
有人影的远景: 可是又放下了。

Landscape with Figures: “I can’t see any more,” she said.
有人影的远景: “我看不下去了。”她说。

Landscape with Figures: The tears were running down her cheeks and her face was working.
有人影的远景: 泪水顺着她的双颊流下，脸上还在抽搐。

Landscape with Figures: I had never seen her cry before and we had seen many things you could cry about if you were going to cry.
有人影的远景: 我从没见过她哭，如果要哭，我们见过许多可以大哭的事情。

Landscape with Figures: In a war everybody of all ranks including generals cries at some time or another.
有人影的远景: 打仗时，各个军衔的人，包括将军，有时也会流泪。

Landscape with Figures: This is true, no matter what people tell you, but it is to be avoided, and is avoided, and I had not seen this girl doing it before.
有人影的远景: 不管人们对你说什么，这句话才是实情。但眼泪总是能忍则忍，而人们也确实是这样做的，所以之前我还没见过这个女孩哭。

Landscape with Figures: “And that’s an attack?”
有人影的远景: “这就是一场进攻？”

Landscape with Figures: “That’s an attack,” I said.
